title: Augusta County: Unkown to Unkown, 1865
summary: Writings (perhaps a speech) by an unknown author, consisting of reflections about the year 1865 and the feelings surrounding the "parting of schoolgirls." Several large pieces of the paper are missing, including a rough square about 3" across by 1.5" high on the bottom left of the first page; this, of course, means a similar section is missing on the second page, which is truly the back of the first. A long strip seems to have been ripped off of the bottom of the final page.
keywords: Arts/Leisure, Family, Women, American Civil War
